sn22.122:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
sn22.122:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita came out of solitude, went to Venerable Sāriputta,
sn22.122:4.4: “Reverend Sāriputta, what things should an ethical mendicant carefully focus on?”
sn22.122:4.5: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, an ethical mendicant should carefully focus on the five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.
sn22.122:4.8: the grasping aggregates of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn22.122:4.9: An ethical mendicant should carefully focus on these five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.
sn22.122:4.10: It’s possible that an ethical mendicant who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of stream-entry.”
sn22.122:5.1: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should an mendicant stream-enterer carefully focus on?”
sn22.122:5.2: “A mendicant stream-enterer should carefully focus on these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.
sn22.122:5.4: It’s possible that a mendicant stream-enterer who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of once-return.”
sn22.122:6.1: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should an mendicant once-returner carefully focus on?”
sn22.122:6.2: “A mendicant once-returner should carefully focus on these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.
sn22.122:6.4: It’s possible that a mendicant once-returner who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of non-return.”
sn22.122:7.1: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should an mendicant non-returner carefully focus on?”
sn22.122:7.2: “A mendicant non-returner should carefully focus on these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.
sn22.122:7.4: It’s possible that a mendicant non-returner who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize perfection.”
sn22.122:8.1: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a perfected one carefully focus on?”
sn22.122:8.2: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, a perfected one should carefully focus on the five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.
sn22.122:8.3: A perfected one has nothing more to do, and nothing that needs improvement.
sn22.122:8.4: Still, these things, when developed and cultivated, lead to blissful meditation in the present life, and also to mindfulness and situational awareness.”
